ranked_diseases.explanation: Russell-Silver Syndrome is characterized by features like short stature, delayed skeletal maturation, and hand abnormalities. Although macrodontia is less characteristic, the other phenotypes make it a primary consideration.
Noonan Syndrome 1 includes short stature and delayed skeletal maturation, alongside other characteristic features. However, macrodontia is not typical, which places it below Russell-Silver Syndrome.
This syndrome involves short stature and skeletal abnormalities, but macrodontia is not a classic feature. It fits some of the skeletal manifestations but less so the full phenotypic pattern.
Sotos Syndrome can present with macrodontia and skeletal anomalies; however, it more typically involves overgrowth, contrasting with the short stature here.
This condition may include short stature and hand abnormalities, but macrodontia and skeletal maturation delay are not prominently featured, thus ranked lower.
